question: How do you choose the correct paint color to mark your queen bee?
option1: Apiarists have designated colors for identify the years that queens were born. Mark your queen in the year she was born. Years ending in 1 or 6 are signified by white paint. Years ending in 2 or 7 are signified by yellow paint. Years ending in 3 or 8 are signified by red paint. Years ending in 4 or 9 are signified by green paint. Years ending in 5 or 0 are signified by blue paint. Choose the color that signifies the year she was born in.
option2: Apiarists have designated colors for identify the years that queens were born. Mark your queen in the year after she was born. Years ending in 1 or 6 are signified by white paint. Years ending in 2 or 7 are signified by yellow paint. Years ending in 3 or 8 are signified by red paint. Years ending in 4 or 9 are signified by green paint. Years ending in 5 or 0 are signified by blue paint. Choose the color that signifies the year she was born in.

question: How to make a cherry Cobbler at home.
option1: Wash  4 cups fresh or frozen tart cherries coat with 1/4 cup Lemon Juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place cherries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.
option2: Wash  4 cups fresh or frozen tart cherries coat with 1/4 cup Lemon Juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place cherries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust under everything under the pans surface.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.

question: How to make Hazlenut Nutella Fantasy fudge at home.
option1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce jar Nutella until thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 3/4 cup Hazelnut pieces, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
option2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce jar Nutella until thoroughly combined. question: How to patch up a hole in drywall.
option1: Cut around the area of the hole into a square, then measure the square and cut another piece of drywall to size. Hold the new piece in place and drill to the studs. Place joint tape around the edges, then use a joint knife to apply putty. Sand it down when it's dry and wipe clean with a wet washcloth.
option2: Cut around the area of the hole into a square, then measure the square and cut another piece of drywall to size. Hold the new piece in place and scotch tape it to the studs. Place joint tape around the edges, then use a joint knife to apply putty. Sand it down when it's dry and wipe clean with a wet washcloth.

question: How to Make Biscuits and Gravy
option1: To make Biscuits and Gravy, first prepare your choice of biscuits, according to the recipe. Then, heat a skillet on medium high to brown the sausage. Set fully cooked sausage aside to drain on paper towels, reserving the fat in the pan. Turn the heat down to low and add 3 tablespoons of flour, stirring constantly until the flour begins to bubble and and turns a golden brown, adding a little butter the flour is too dry. Pour in 3 cups of milk and whisk often so the milk doesn't scorch. Continue whisking for several minutes until the mixture starts to thicken. Serve over biscuits.
option2: To make Biscuits and Gravy, first prepare your choice of biscuits, according to the recipe. Then, heat a skillet on medium high to brown the sausage. Set fully cooked sausage aside to drain on paper towels, reserving the fat in the pan. Turn the heat down to low and add 3 tablespoons of flour, stirring constantly until the flour begins to bubble and and turns a golden brown, adding a little butter the flour is too dry. Pour in 3 cups of milk and whisk often so the milk doesn't scorch. Continue whisking for several minutes until the mixture starts to thin. Serve over biscuits.

question: Prepare a miter saw to cut wood
option1: Lift the blade guard with your thumb and sight down one edge of the blade to align your cut. Firmly hold or clamp the wood. Then suddenly release the blade guard and leave your hand to the switch to make your cut.
option2: Lift the blade guard with your thumb and sight down one edge of the blade to align your cut. Firmly hold or clamp the wood. Then gradually release the blade guard and return your hand to the switch to make your cut.

question: Freeze fresh avocado
option1: Cut the fruit in half, and peel. If you are opting to keep them as halves, put them in a Ziploc bag and boil. If you're pureeing, either mash the avocados with a fork or in a food processor with a little bit of lime or lemon. Store in a resealable bag and freeze.
option2: Cut the fruit in half, and peel. If you are opting to keep them as halves, put them in a Ziploc bag and freeze. If you're pureeing, either mash the avocados with a fork or in a food processor with a little bit of lime or lemon. Store in a resealable bag and freeze.

question: To prepare pumpkin for roasting in the oven.
option1: Preheat oven to 325. Cut the stem off the sugar pumpkin, then slice pumpkin into quarters. Scoop out the flesh into a bowl (set flesh and seeds aside) and brush the pumpkin pieces with olive oil. Sprinkle each piece with salt (about 1/2 tsp) and freshly ground black pepper (about 1/4 tsp). Prick the pieces with a spoon a few times and roast in the oven until pumpkin is very tender, approximately 2 hours.
option2: Preheat oven to 325. Cut the stem off the sugar pumpkin, then slice pumpkin into quarters. Scoop out the flesh into a bowl (set flesh and seeds aside) and brush the pumpkin pieces with olive oil. Sprinkle each piece with salt (about 1/2 tsp) and freshly ground black pepper (about 1/4 tsp). Prick the pieces with a fork a few times and roast in the oven until pumpkin is very tender, approximately 2 hours.

question: How to make magnetic slime
option1: In a bowl, pour 4 ounces of school glue. Carefully pour 1/3 cup water into the glue in the glue container and shake. add this water to the glue in the bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of magnets and 1/2 cup liquid starch to the mixture. Stir until combined and knead until stringy.
option2: in a bowl, pour 4 ounces of school glue. Carefully pour 1/3 cup water into the glue in the glue container and shake. add this water to the glue in the bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of iron oxide and 1/2 cup liquid starch to the mixture. Stir until combined and knead until stringy.
